verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; after the manner of Jeduthun. A Psalm of David. My soul <S%H5315><s%> waiteth <S%H1747><s%> in silence for God <S%H430><s%> only <S%H3444><s%>: From him cometh my salvation.
He only is my rock <S%H6697><s%> and my salvation <S%H3444><s%>: He is my high tower <S%H4869><s%>; I shall not be greatly <S%H7227><s%> moved <S%H4131><s%>.

How long will ye set upon <S%H2050><s%> a man <S%H376><s%>, That ye may slay <S%H7523><s%> him <S%H5186><s%>, all of you, Like a leaning wall <S%H7023><s%>, like a tottering <S%H1760><s%> fence <S%H1447><s%>?

They only consult <S%H3289><s%> to thrust him down <S%H5080><s%> from his dignity <S%H7613><s%>; They delight <S%H7521><s%> in lies <S%H3577><s%>; They bless <S%H1288><s%> with their mouth <S%H6310><s%>, but they curse <S%H7043><s%> inwardly <S%H7130><s%>. <S%H5542><s%>[[Selah
My soul <S%H5315><s%>, wait <S%H1826><s%> thou in silence for God <S%H430><s%> only <S%H8615><s%>; For my expectation is from him.
He only is my rock <S%H6697><s%> and my salvation <S%H3444><s%>: He is my high tower <S%H4869><s%>; I shall not be moved <S%H4131><s%>.
With God <S%H430><s%> is my salvation <S%H3468><s%> and my glory <S%H3519><s%>: The rock <S%H6697><s%> of my strength <S%H5797><s%>, and my refuge <S%H4268><s%>, is in God <S%H430><s%>.

Trust <S%H982><s%> in him at all times <S%H6256><s%>, ye people <S%H5971><s%>; Pour out <S%H8210><s%> your heart <S%H3824><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him <S%H430><s%>: God is a refuge <S%H4268><s%> for us <S%H5542><s%>. [[Selah

Surely men <S%H120><s%> of low degree are vanity <S%H1892><s%>, and men <S%H376><s%> of high degree are a lie <S%H3577><s%>: In <S%H5927><s%> the balances <S%H3976><s%> they will go up <S%H3162><s%>; They are together lighter than vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

Trust <S%H982><s%> not in oppression <S%H6233><s%>, And become not vain <S%H1891><s%> in robbery <S%H1498><s%>: If riches <S%H2428><s%> increase <S%H5107><s%>, set <S%H7896><s%> not your heart thereon <S%H3820><s%>.
God <S%H430><s%> hath spoken <S%H1696><s%> once <S%H259><s%>, Twice <S%H8147><s%> have I heard <S%H8085><s%> this <S%H2098><s%>, That power <S%H5797><s%> belongeth unto God <S%H430><s%>.
Also unto thee <S%H136><s%>, O Lord, belongeth lovingkindness <S%H2617><s%>; For thou renderest <S%H7999><s%> to every man <S%H376><s%> according to his work <S%H4639><s%>.
